meanings.definition: To respond excessively or too strongly to something.
meanings.sent1: She overresponded to the joke by laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: He always overresponded to criticism by getting defensive.
meanings.sent3: The puppy overresponded to the doorbell, thinking it was a new friend.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden overresponded to the rain, blooming vibrantly.
meanings.sent5: The child overresponded to the surprise, jumping with joy.

meanings.definition: To react in an exaggerated or disproportionate manner.
meanings.sent1: They overresponded to the news by shouting with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The actor overresponded to the scene, making it seem unrealistic.
meanings.sent3: The cat overresponded to the laser pointer, pouncing wildly.
meanings.sent4: The tree overresponded to the wind, swaying dramatically.
meanings.sent5: The student overresponded to the quiz results, celebrating excessively.
